top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*

Youngkin has run an effective campaign but definitely not an honest one especially in regards to education. He’s promised to ban CRT from being taught in schools. It’s not. He also has politicized a tragic sexual assault in a Loudoun County school that other GOP operatives have tied to a transgender bathroom policy despite it coming into effect after the incident.

Mcauliffe’s campaign has made a lot of missteps that have cost them dearly though. And he has run a bad campaign.

> Youngkin now runs ahead among voters who say education is their most important issue. In the Washington Post-Schar School poll, Youngkin once trailed McAuliffe by 33 points among the tiny slice of voters who said education was their most important issue. Now, as it’s surged to the No. 1 issue, Youngkin leads by 9 points among those voters.

That's pretty shocking.

I think he’s going to win it. He’s successfully towed the line on appealing ti the MAGA base whilst not associating with them too much to alienate the moderates. He killed it on making education a priority.
